title.narrative: PREVENTION AND RESPONSE TO VAC & GBV

description.narrative: Strengthened capacities, multi-sectoral programs, services and evidence-base for prevention and response to Violence against Children (VaC) & Gender Based Violence (GBV) and for creating a safe and protective environment for children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, social services, the child protection system and the administration of justice more effectively prevent violence, protect child victims and ensure access to timely remedy to child participants in judicial procedures, including in humanitarian situations

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

related-activity.ref: 0570/A0/05/003 PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AND ACCESS TO JUSTICE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened capacities, multi-sectoral programs, services and evidence-base for prevention and response to Violence againstChildren (VaC) & Gender Based Violence (GBV) and for creating a safe and protective environment for children.

description.narrative: 1,295 children and 1,295 parents;have benefitted from specialized VaC and GBV prevention and response. This impact was supported with a robust advocacy that arrived from the national;VaC study. The ;inter-agency GBV pocket guide ;that; improved capacity of 317;frontline workers was introduced in Sofia and Plovidiv Universities;curriculum. In addition, the capacity of1,048 professionals from the CP system was strengthened to provide multi-disciplinary response to cases of children victims of domestic violence. ;On-line protection work was also strengthened and contributed to 290 children, parents and professionals reached with on-line information sessions on prevention of cyberviolence and available support services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022
